cooked:
We‚Äôve noticed a significant drop in Snowflake users from Russia, starting earlier this month, along with some vantage point testing that suggests a different kind of block than what we‚Äôve seen before.

users-ru1000√ó390 12.6 KB

At first we thought this was due to several recent certificate renewals of Fastly front domains that were used for Snowflake, but we‚Äôve since ruled out blocking of rendezvous channel. The timing of the drop in users also doesn‚Äôt quite match up with the domain renewals.

From our vantage point tests, it does not look like the DTLS fingerprinting of Snowflake that happened in Russia in 2021. The DTLS handshake completes and several bytes of application data are received from the proxy before the client suddenly stops receiving data. This doesn‚Äôt rule out fingerprinting. There are a few proxies that do not appear to be blocked and Tor can be fully bootstrapped through these proxies, but we haven‚Äôt noticed any difference in the DTLS fingerprint between working proxies and proxies that go stale. It‚Äôs also possible that our vantage point tests aren‚Äôt offering an accurate view of why there is a drop in users.

Related Links:

  • Snowflake GitLab issue: Snowflake partially blocked in Russia 2024-11 (#40407) ¬∑ Issues ¬∑ The Tor Project / Anti-censorship / Pluggable Transports / Snowflake ¬∑ GitLab
  • Full analysis of previous DTLS fingerprinting: Make Snowflake's DTLS fingerprint more similar to popular WebRTC implementations (#40014) ¬∑ Issues ¬∑ The Tor Project / Anti-censorship / Pluggable Transports / Snowflake ¬∑ GitLab
  • net4people BBS issue: Drop in Snowflake users from Russia and evidence of blocking starting 2024-11 ¬∑ Issue #422 ¬∑ net4people/bbs ¬∑ GitHub

name: anon
cooked:
To me it looks similar to wireguard blocking, there is hardshake, but it drops systematically after 20 seconds had passed. Luckily, due to decentralized design of snowflake, it will eventually hop to life through many peers. Even if it takes hours.

I suspect they sooner will block the broker (along all the CDNs), if you read the recent news. They don‚Äôt care about collateral damage anymore, look at Hetzner thread, so I‚Äôm not sure why they bothering with‚Ä¶ blocking the snowflakes in the first place?

It works for me on Yota. But the ISP is blocking Hetzner.
